Problem Statement:
There are M criminals and N Gun Shops on a map .

The coordinates of the i-th criminal  ( 1 ≤ i ≤ N) is (ai , bi), and the coordinates of the gun shop numbered   j ( 1 ≤ j ≤ M ) is ( cj , dj ) .

Suppose a criminal is going for buying a gun to kill Sherlock so you will go to the nearest Gun Shop measured in Manhattan distance. 

The Manhattan distance between two points (x1 , y1) and (x2 , y2) is  |x1−x2| + |y1−y2|.

Here, |x| denotes the absolute value of x.

If there are multiple nearest shops for a criminal, he/she will select the shop with the smallest index i.e the shop which comes first in the order .

Which shop will each criminal  go to ?
Input:
The first line of input contains the value of N ,M .

Then N lines follow denoting the index of each criminal .

Then M lines follow denoting the index of each gun shop.
Output:
The output contains N lines .
Each line denoting the shop that i-th criminal will go to .
Constraints:
1 ≤ N , M  ≤  50
−10^8 ≤   ai,bi,cj,dj    ≤   10^8
All input values are integers.
